title: How Macron threw his supporters into a panic by calling snap elections
summary: President Emmanuel Macron's surprise announcement sent shockwaves through all levels of government. His coalition's ministers and lawmakers in particular experienced confusion, anger and fear, as many expected the move to backfire. Le Monde takes a deep dive into the hours that preceded and days that followed his decision.

title: 'Macron, who triggered this dissolution to trap the parties, has trapped himself'
summary: By accelerating the political realignment, the dissolution of the Assemblée Nationale is also bringing back the right-left divide Emmanuel Macron had sought to erase, explains Le Monde columnist Solenn de Royer.

title: What's a cohabitation in French politics and what are the precedents?
summary: In the history of the Fifth Republic, there have been three cohabitations, a term used in France when the president and prime minister come from opposing political camps. Emmanuel Macron's call for snap parliamentary elections could lead to a fourth.

title: France's snap election campaign begins as deadline for registration passes
summary: Candidates had until Sunday evening to file paperwork. They now have less than two weeks before the first round of voting, on June 30.

title: Raphaël LLorca: 'It is as if Macron's act had psychologically authorized the liquidation of all political limits'
summary: The French president's decision has had the effect of plunging the political arena into a form of 'political psychosis,' opening up a window of opportunity that encourages all kinds of transgressions, writes essayist Raphaël LLorca.

title: What we know about electoral projections for the upcoming French elections
summary: The snap elections of June 30 and July 7 are very difficult to predict given the high number of uncertainties on voter turnout and political alliances.

title: EU leaders end Brussels meeting without decision on top job nominations
summary: The 27 leaders were expected to decide on a list of nominations for some of the bloc's most prestigious positions following the European elections on June 6-9.

title: Austrian own goal helps France win first Euro 2024 match as late collision leaves Mbappé with broken nose
summary: Coach Didier Deschamps did not confirm the extent of the injury, but did say the star player is 'in a bad state'. Mbappé will not need an operation, according to the president of the French Football Federation.

title: French architect Paul Chemetov has died
summary: A major figure in French architecture and urban planning, the architect died in Paris on June 16, aged 95. He was notably behind the design of France's Ministry of Economy and the renovation of the Grand Gallery of Evolution at the National Museum of Natural History.

title: Netanyahu dissolves Israel's war cabinet
summary: An Israeli government spokesman confirmed the Israeli prime minister had dissolved the war cabinet, following the resignation earlier this month of centrist leader Benn Gantz.

title: China has mixed feelings about Putin's new coziness with Kim
summary: The Russian president is due to visit North Korea on Tuesday and Wednesday as part of a calculated rapprochement that leaves Beijing feeling conflicted.

title: Ukrainian pilots given an intensified training course in France to fly F-16s
summary: The French Air Force has committed to certifying the training of 26 Ukrainian pilots over a two-year period.

title: 'An economic policy that doesn't make sense is immediately punished by the market'
summary: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' Emmanuel Roman, director general of PIMCO, the world's leading bond fund, warns of the risks of market sanctions in France at a time when the far right is on the brink of power.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Boats take part in Seine opening ceremony rehearsal
summary: A total of 55 boats, flanked by police, made the journey from the Pont d'Austerlitz to the Pont d'Iéna as the French capital prepares to hold a spectacular show to open the Games.

title: EU passes biodiversity law as Austrian climate minister defies chancellor
summary: The legislation requires the European Union's 27 member states to put in place measures to restore at least 20% of the bloc's land and seas by 2030.

title: Ibrahima Konaté: 'The Euro is going to be harder than the World Cup'
summary: Ahead of France's European Championships opener against Austria on Monday evening, the central defender spoke to Le Monde about his rise role with Les Bleus, where he is once again vying for a starting position.

title: Giorgia Meloni's Italy is tempted by nuclear power
summary: The country had voted no to nuclear power in referenda after the Chernobyl and Fukushima incidents. Energy Minister Gilberto Pichetto Fratin told Le Monde that his government aims to reintroduce 'a share of nuclear' power, despite legal challenges.

title: 'Judging Putin and Netanyahu necessarily implies a fair and adversarial trial'
summary: While the two leaders do not recognize the authority of the International Criminal Court, Sandrine de Sena, legal consultant before the ICC, analyzes the options that would enable them to be judged fairly, even in their absence.

title: Eurosatory: 'the backroom for everything fueling the Russian-Ukrainian war'
summary: Since the 2022 edition, during which Emmanuel Macron called on defense companies to adopt a 'war economy,' military spending has risen to over €2,000 billion. 'Le Monde' business correspondent Jean-Michel Bezat observes that, at the same time, with the help of AI, equipment and programs have been profoundly transformed.
